title: Enthalpy change for Oxidation of CO

content.question:
Bond Type 
Average Bond Enthalpy <math alttext="in kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="C C single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></math> 
360 

<math alttext="C O double bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
799 

<math alttext="C O triple bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>≡</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
1072 

<math alttext="O O single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
142 

<math alttext="O O double bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
498 

The oxidation of carbon monoxide can be represented by the chemical equation <math alttext="2 C O gas, plus O 2 gas, react to produce, 2 C O 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>CO</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The table above provides the average bond enthalpies for different bond types. Based on the information in the table, which of the following mathematical expressions is correct for the estimated enthalpy change for the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta H sub reaction equals, open bracket, 2 times 1072 kilojoules per mole, plus 498 kilojoules per mole, close bracket, minus, 2 times 799 kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>(</mtext><mn>1072</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>498</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)]</mtext></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>799</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H sub reaction equals, open bracket, 2 times 1072 kilojoules per mole, plus 498 kilojoules per mole, close bracket, minus, 4 times 799 kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mn>2</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>1072</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>498</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>799</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta H sub reaction equals, open bracket, 2 times 799 kilojoules per mole, plus 142 kilojoules per mole, close bracket, minus, 4 times 360 kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>799</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>142</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>360</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H sub reaction equals, open bracket, 2 times 799 kilojoules per mole, plus 142 kilojoules per mole, close bracket, minus, 2 times 360 kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>799</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>142</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>360</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta H sub reaction equals, open bracket, 2 times 1072 kilojoules per mole, plus 498 kilojoules per mole, close bracket, minus, 4 times 799 kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mn>2</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>1072</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>498</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>799</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
